answers.answer: Hi,What you may be experiencing could be early menopause. Hormonal changes related to menopause may start from about 45 yrs age, depending on race, country of residence, food habits etc, but 43 is also a possible age for these problems.Other things that may be looked into are urinary tract infection, diabetes mellitus, hyperthyroidism.Please consult a gynecologist for these symptoms, if menopause is not a possibility, then you may look at the other possibilities.Regards

question: I have heavy breasts, sensitive sore hard nipples, frequent urge to urinate, pain in the urinary area, worse when urinating, hot flushes, prickly heat and restless sleep at night. I'm 43 female healthy, did a pregnancy test - negative.IF it were a urinary tract problem, why would I be having the other hormonal symptoms along with it?Any other ideas?
title: Please help, very uncomfortable!
